page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Villages on the rim of the Greater London Area are greatly cherished in these days of the urban sprawl. This area of 12 square kilometres lies between 4 such villages,Pratts Bottom, Downe,Cudham and Knockholt and is in the centre of the Green Belt often said to be the "lungs of London". In all these villages it is still possible to find peace and clean air. There is little in the way of industry other than farming, with many of the residents commuting to London to work. The area is very popular at weekends as people leave the towns in search of recreation. Riding and walking are very popular pursuits and the local inns are well frequented. Housing is varied, from small cottages to large mansions and is very expensive as demand is high. The following pages give a brief description of the area.
